alicia.bio: Alicia grew up in Half Moon Bay, CA. She received her bachelor's degree in business at Drexel University, then completed her Juris Doctorate at Wake Forest School of Law. After law school, Alicia passed the California bar exam and worked for the San Francisco Family Court. She then moved onto LexisNexis and BARBRI as a Director of Sales for three states. Two years ago, Alicia decided to pursue her MBA at Kellogg Northwestern School of Management. She now works at Quid, a data visualization tool using machine learning and AI to quickly identify and analyze key insights.
alicia.talkTitle: Fastest Growing Area of Machine Learning Science

caren.bio: Android Engineer currently working at June, helping create a smart oven that will help anybody be able to make delicious food. Originally from Southern California, but Bay Area resident for almost 10 years now! Always amazed and curious at how easy the Android APIs make everything seem, when there’s so much more going on under the hood.

linda.bio: Linda is a senior engineer with a master’s degree in Software Engineering for Carnegie Mellon University. Originally from Mexico City, she has lived in Silicon Valley for the past 8 years. She has worked at Electronic Arts and Sears Online Business Unit before joining Netflix. She has been with the Messaging team for 4 years now, where she is responsible for the infrastructure that makes possible to send 100 million unique messages localized in 26 languages to our customers around the world.
linda.talkTitle: How customer messages are created at Netflix?

minko.bio: Minko is co-founder of Rhyme.com and has a big passion for open source. He loves to experiment with theoretical computer science concepts and apply them in practice. Minko teaches, speaks and writes about JavaScript and Angular. Some of the projects he works on are his books 'Switching to Angular 2',  'Getting started with Angular', codelyzer, the official Angular style guide, angular-seed and many others.

murat.bio: Murat Yener is a code geek, open source committer, Java Champion and ex-Google Developer Expert on Android, who is working at Google on Google Home. He is the author of Expert Android Studio and Professional Java EE Design Patterns books from Wiley. He has extensive experience with developing Android, Java, web, JavaEE, and OSGi applications, in addition to teaching courses and mentoring. Murat was an Eclipse committer and one of the initial committers of the Eclipse Libra project. Murat had been a user group leader at GDG Istanbul and in GDG San Francisco, organizing, participating, and speaking at events. He is also a regular speaker at major conferences such as DroidCon, JavaOne and Devoxx.

rupali.bio: Rupali Sharma is a programmer with Gameplay Services at Electronic Arts. She holds a bachelor degree from India, and has been partner in crime to produce and fix bugs for almost 10 years. Rupali has been actively involved with several non-profit institutions (like Girls Who Code, Code.org and Sahasra Deepika (India)), encouraging young girls to pursue careers in STEM. In her spare time, Rupali enjoys writing technical articles, playing around with open source SDKs and traveling. Along with, she is also part of Inclusion & Diversity group at EA. Prior to EA, Rupali had nurtured herself at Intel, ARM and Packet Video. She firmly believes, more women contributing to technology, will spin the wheel of innovation in a new arena, solving more meaningful problems.

sneha.bio: Sneha is a software development engineer at Amazon in Seattle, WA. She's worked for Audible, Pluribus Networks, VMware, and Avaya. She graduated with a Master's degree in CS from University of Pennsylvania in 2017 and a Bachelor's degree in CS in 2015 and was one of the youngest students in her graduating class. She's passionate about AI and working with data and her research focus at Penn was in the fields of Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing, and Deep Learning.  She has presented her work at notable conferences like the Grace Hopper Celebration for Women in Computing, Mid-Atlantic Student Colloquium on Speech, Language and Learning, and the Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics. She is also passionate about supporting women in technology and is currently working on a project that connects disadvantaged girls in developing countries like India who are trying to enter into STEAM fields, to find mentorship and support.
sneha.talkTitle: Learning negating semantics using a morphology-aware neural network

vikram.bio: Building scalable web platforms for high availability, resilience, and security. #GDE @GoogleCloud. Founding team member and all things tech @omnilabsinc
vikram.talkTitle: Data science on Google Cloud Platform

justin.profession: Chief Executive Officer | Google Developer Expert
justin.bio: Dad. Husband. Software Engineer. CEO. Speaker. Google Developer Expert. Failed voiceover actor who hosts The Web Platform Podcast.

miguel.bio: Miguel is a Developer Advocate at Clover, where he works with third-party developers building merchant solutions on one of the largest open point-of-sale platforms. Previously, he’s worked on user experience, accessibility, and world readiness as a Program Manager at Microsoft. In his free time, he likes writing, traveling, and watching college football.
miguel.talkTitle: Master Conversationalist: Building Conversational Agents on Google Assistant with API.AI

prosper.bio: Prosper is an avid Open Source Advocate, Evangelist, and a Google Developer Expert in Web Technologies. He is a full stack software engineer who has worked on biometric, health and developer tools. Prosper is a prolific technical writer and works with developers and teams across the globe, building, improving web performance and raising communities that will groom the next generation of world-class software engineers.

abraham.bio: An experienced developer, start-up founder, and international speaker, Abraham Williams brings a broad range of skills to his current role as a senior developer at Bendyworks. A top 1% contributor at Stack Overflow and an active member of Google Developer Groups, Abraham has been recognized by Google as a Developer Expert for his ability to identify technology problems and provide quality solutions in the community.
abraham.talkTitle: Get talking with Actions on Google

harald.bio: Web citizen, craftsman & neonomad who works on Devtools, Performance and Web Platform as Technical Product Manager.

tyrone.employer: Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation
tyrone.bio: Dr. Tyrone W A Grandison is the first-ever Chief Information Officer (CIO) of the Institute of Health Metrics and Evaluation -  an independent global health research center at the University of Washington that provides rigorous and comparable measurement of the world's most important health problems and evaluates the strategies used to address them.  Dr. Grandison also advises the Government of Jamaica on their Information Technology strategy - as a member of the National Information and Communications Technology Advisory Council (2016-18). He served as the first-ever Chief Operating Officer (COO) of Data Driven Industries (2016). He was the Deputy Chief Data Officer (dCDO) at the US Department of Commerce (2015-16), where he co-founded the Commerce Data Service - a data startup within the Department that supported its twelve bureaus - and led the successful rollout of its first 15 products. He was also a White House Presidential Innovation Fellow (2014-15) working with the US Department of Labor and the US CENSUS Bureau on their data and API (application programming interface) initiatives.

jessicap.bio: Jessica Parsons has spent half her life teaching, and a quarter of it developing for the web. She now combines those passions as a documentation engineer at Netlify. Outside of her day job, she teaches workshops and develops curriculum for Girl Develop It. Away from a computer screen, she's baked and decorated wedding cakes, designed and sewn prize-winning garments, and taken apart and repaired all sorts of home appliances. She has even had someone dress up as *her* for Halloween!
jessicap.talkTitle: Build a Slack Integration with Google Cloud Functions for Firebase
